intro: Colea coccinea, commonly known as the scarlet bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking red, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Colea coccinea is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color.
